intro: Scleria huberi, commonly known as the Natal flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flower heads. Scleria huberi typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in wetlands. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
